p: Dengue fever is due to an infection of one of the four DENV serotypes transmitted to humans through the bite of an infected female mosquito of the Aedes genus [ 5]. In Lao Peopleâ€™s Democratic Republic (Lao PDR), the main vector in urban areas is Aedes aegypti [ 6], whereas Aedes albopictus is considered a secondary vector, specifically in suburban, rural, and forested areas [ 5, 7, 8].
